biotools.summary:
Accurate assembly of segmental duplications, satellites, and allelic variants from high-fidelity long reads.

Canu is a fork of the Celera Assembler, designed for high-noise single-molecule sequencing (such as the PacBio RS II/Sequel or Oxford Nanopore MinION).

Koren N, Walenz BP, Rhie A, Vollger M, Grothe R, Logsdon GA, Eichler EE, Phillippy AM, Koren S. HiCanu: precise assembly of segmental duplications and haplotypes using high-fidelity long reads. Biorxiv. (2020).

Canu is a hierarchical assembly pipeline which runs in four steps:.

Detect overlaps in high-noise sequences using MHAP.
